Articles.Content:
So I've installed a load of mods for my game, and when I fired the game up the loading screen got stuck loading the stock circular intake. I went into my GameData folder a clicked on the Squad folder to try and see what was wrong with it, but when I clicked on the folder a message appeared on my computer saying I couldn't access the folder and after closing that message the Squad folder simply vanished. disappeared. without a trace. I thought this may be that my computer was hiding the Squad folder so I didn't access it, but when I tried loading KSP I was greeted by a completely black screen and nothing else. Pls help people my Kerbals need you! 

 

 

 

 

 

umm just realised this is a MODDED install and I put it on the UNMODDED intalls support area (mods please move it)

Edited July 5, 2019 by Spacenerd Kerman
in the wrong place rn...

Are you on Steam?

Are you looking on the correct install location?Maybe its in a different folder?

Check your recycling bin just in case...

Uhmm this sounds like a user permission problem, admin rights etc.

Try to view the hidden files:Click View at the top of the folder window then Hidden items.

I wouldn't bother with triage at this point.  Move your mods and saves to safe place.   Uninstall the game.  Re-install the game.  See if it fires up stock.  If it does, put your mods and saves back.

If it doesn't, or it breaks after re-installing the mods, then look into it.

 

Although a health check on your storage drive would certainly be a good idea.
